name: K2-183
scenarioDescription:
The K2-183 Exoplanetary System

K2-183 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.97 times its radius. It is located 1082.09 light years away from the solar system.

K2-183 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-183 c

K2-183 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2018-02. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.79 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-183.

The mass of K2-183 c is 12.08 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-183 c is 2.87 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-183 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

K2-183 d

K2-183 d was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2018-02. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 22.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-183.

The mass of K2-183 d is 11.96 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-183 d is 2.86 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-183 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-183, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by K2.
